com.samysadi.acs.core

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.core.notifications.NotifierImpl
      • com.samysadi.acs.core.tracing.ProbedImpl
        • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.EntityImpl
          • com.samysadi.acs.core.Simulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity, Notifier, Probed, Cloneable

    public class Simulator
extends EntityImpl
    A simulator is an Entity that is the ancestor of all other entities.

    This class defines methods to schedule events and to start/stop the processing of those events based on their scheduled process time, and the order when they were added (if they were scheduled at the same time).

    One simulator can be instantiated per execution thread. If you instantiated a simulator on a thread then you want to to instantiate a new simulator on the same thread, then you need to first discard the first simulator using the free() method.

    Static methods are offered in order to format data for various simulation units.
    Main simulation units are as follow:

    • Time: MILLISECONDs;
    • Data size: BYTEs;
    • Data rate: BYTEs per one second;
    • Computing task length: MIs;
    • Computing speed: mips, MIs per one second;
    • Power: WATTs;
    • Energy: WATT hours;
    • Currency code: CURRENCY_CODE;
    • Currency symbol: CURRENCY_SYMBOL;
    • Currency unit: CURRENCY_UNIT.
    There is also other immutable values computed based on the previous values.

    If you need different precision for previous values, use SimulatorUnits methods before loading this class.

    Since:
    1.0

      • setParent

        public void setParent(Entity entity)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Updates the parent of this entity.
        This method makes sure that the old and the new parent keep their entities list updated, by automatically calling Entity.addEntity(Entity) and Entity.removeEntity(Entity).

        A CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED notification is thrown.
        Additionally, each descendant of this entity (ie: entities who have this entity as their direct or not direct parent) are notified using CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_ANCESTOR_CHANGED.

        Specified by:
        setParent in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        setParent in class EntityImpl

      • cancel

        public void cancel(Event event)
        Cancels the given event, and removes it from this simulator's event queue.

        After calling this method the event is not scheduled anymore, and can be rescheduled again at another simulation time safely.

        Prefer to use Event.cancel() which is safe even if the given event is not scheduled.

        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given event is not scheduled

      • schedule

        public void schedule(Event event)
        Schedules the given event to be processed at the current simulator time (getTime()).

        This method is the same as schedule(0, Event).

        Parameters:
        event - the event to be scheduled

      • schedule

        public void schedule(long delay,
            Event event)
        Schedules the given event to be processed after that the given delay has passed.
        In other words, schedules the given event to be processed at Simulator.getTime() + delay.
        Parameters:
        delay -
        event - the event to be scheduled
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given event is already scheduled, or if the given time is in the past

      • getMaximumScheduleDelay

        public long getMaximumScheduleDelay()
        Returns the maximum delay value that can be used when scheduling events using schedule(long, Event) method.
        Returns:
        the maximum delay value that can be used when scheduling events using schedule(long, Event) method

      • getRandomGenerator

        public Random getRandomGenerator(Object key)
        Returns a random generator that matches the given key.

        This method first tries to find an existing instance matching the given key. If none is found one instantiated and returned and further calls to this function with the same key will return the same instance.

        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        a random generator that matches the given key

      • setRandomGenerator

        public void setRandomGenerator(Random random)
        Updates the random generator of the simulator to the given value.

        If given random is null then default simulator's random generator is set.

        You can restore previous context using restoreRandomGenerator().

        Parameters:
        random -

      • setRandomGenerator

        public void setRandomGenerator(Object key)
        Updates the random generator of the simulator using the given key.

        If given key is null then default simulator's random generator is set.

        You can restore previous context using restoreRandomGenerator().

        Parameters:
        key -

      • restoreRandomGenerator

        public Random restoreRandomGenerator()
        Sets the simulator's random generator to the previous one and returns the current random generator (as it was before changing it).
        Returns:
        old random generator

      • getRandomGeneratorId

        public int getRandomGeneratorId()
        See restoreRandomGenerator(int) for more information about this method.

      • restoreRandomGenerator

        public void restoreRandomGenerator(int id)
        Restores the random context as defined by the given id.

        Random generators are usually set at the beginning of a given code block, and when the block ends, old random generator is restored.
        Though, if an exception happens before the block ends, the generator is never restored. This is not a problem if exceptions are intended to end the simulation, which is the most common expected behavior. Thus, we can avoid to explicitly put the code between a try .. finally block which will unnecessarily impact simulation performances.
        However, if you plan to catch the exception, you may need to restore the random generator before continuing. To do so, call the getRandomGeneratorId() method before the risky code and call this method when catching an exception.

      • getLogger

        public Logger getLogger()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Returns a Logger instance for this Entity.

        Default is to return the logger of the parent of this entity.

        If this entity has a null parent, then Logger.getGlobal() is returned.

      • formatTime

        public static String formatTime(long time,
                boolean useAlternativeUnits,
                boolean appendUnits)
        Converts the given time to a human readable string format and returns it.
        Parameters:
        time - the time to convert
        useAlternativeUnits - if false then the time is formatted using seconds only, and will consider alternative time units (minutes, hours, days)
        appendUnits - if false then units are not appended to the returned string. If useAlternativeUnits is true then this parameter is ignored and units are always appended.
        Returns:
        formatted time

      • formatTime

        public static String formatTime(long time)
        See formatTime(time, true, true).

      • formatSize

        public static String formatSize(long size,
                boolean useAlternativeUnits,
                boolean appendUnits,
                boolean si)
        Converts the given size to a human readable string format and returns it.
        Parameters:
        size - the size to convert
        useAlternativeUnits - if false then the size is formatted using bytes only, and will not consider alternative units (kilo/kibi, Mega/Mebi, Giga/Gibi etc...)
        appendUnits - if false then units are not appended to the returned string. If useAlternativeUnits is true then this parameter is ignored and units are always appended.
        si - if true then use International System 1000-based units (ie: kilo, Mega, Giga etc...).
        If false then use usual 1024-based units (ie: kibi, Mebi, Gibi etc...). This parameter is only relevant if the useAlternativeUnits parameter is true.
        Returns:
        formatted size

      • formatSize
